messages.message: Hi there! I think us attacking each other early game is pretty dumb, what’re your thoughts?
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Hi there! I think us attacking each other early game is pretty dumb, what’re your thoughts?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. The proposition to avoid early conflicts and seek mutual understanding demonstrates a diplomatic and rational approach to gameplay dynamics, indicating a desire for cooperation and stability within the alliance.

messages.message:
I agree. Even with the element of surprise, it's just too easy to defend the Piedmont/Marseilles corridor.

If France attacks Italy, it will most likely be Austria who benefits, and likewise if Italy attacks France the spoils probably go to Germany.

Given that, what are your plans? Are you planning to attack Austria early, or thinking of the standard move of: 
F Naples - Ionian
A Rome - Naples
A Venice H
messages.input:
My response to ITALY:'I agree. Even with the element of surprise, it's just too easy to defend the Piedmont/Marseilles corridor.

If France attacks Italy, it will most likely be Austria who benefits, and likewise if Italy attacks France the spoils probably go to Germany.

Given that, what are your plans? Are you planning to attack Austria early, or thinking of the standard move of: 
F Naples - Ionian
A Rome - Naples
A Venice H'.

messages.message: Yeah I’m not planning on going for Austria off the bat, I feel like it usually just locks the two weakest countries into a fight that hurts us both
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Yeah I’m not planning on going for Austria off the bat, I feel like it usually just locks the two weakest countries into a fight that hurts us both'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's stance on avoiding an early conflict with Austria aligns with the initial proposal to prioritize cooperation over confrontation, showcasing a consistent approach to fostering alliance stability and strategic gameplay.

messages.message:
My own view is that France can afford to remain neutral longer than England or Germany can. 

As long as I can prevent an English-German alliance, I can afford to remain non-commital and find the right time to strike.

Of course, I already have a hypothesis for who I suspect would be the better ally, but I don't think I can share that :p
messages.input:
My response to ITALY:'My own view is that France can afford to remain neutral longer than England or Germany can. 

As long as I can prevent an English-German alliance, I can afford to remain non-commital and find the right time to strike.

Of course, I already have a hypothesis for who I suspect would be the better ally, but I don't think I can share that :p'.

messages.message: In my view, the fleet going to SC of Spain is a concession to England, but apparently he doesn't see things the same way. I suggest that we demilitarize Western Mediterranean for now. My fleet will go on standby in Lyon to defend Marseilles

messages.message:
Here I my view:
TYS is more vulnerable for me than LYO is for you, it borders two of my home centers which as opposed to 1 home and 1 neutral for you. Additionally, you are in a very good position to defend those centers if I were to move into LYO. So I propose that I hold in TYS and you move from LYO to Spa SC, (I’m assuming you’re moving Spa to Gas) and when I see that I will leave TYS and our DMZ will be in effect.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Here I my view:
TYS is more vulnerable for me than LYO is for you, it borders two of my home centers which as opposed to 1 home and 1 neutral for you. Additionally, you are in a very good position to defend those centers if I were to move into LYO. So I propose that I hold in TYS and you move from LYO to Spa SC, (I’m assuming you’re moving Spa to Gas) and when I see that I will leave TYS and our DMZ will be in effect.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's detailed proposal for a temporary solution to the standoff by holding in Tyrrhenian Sea and suggesting a coordinated move to establish a demilitarized zone between the Gulf of Lyon and Spain supports a diplomatic and cooperative strategy to defuse tensions and maintain stability within the alliance.
